scientists.name: Sigmund Freud
scientists.description: Austrian neurologist and the founder of psychoanalysis.
scientists.bioUrl:
Sigmund Freud was an Austrian neurologist who founded psychoanalysis. Born in Freiberg, Moravia (now part of Czech Republic), Freud developed groundbreaking theories about the unconscious mind and the interpretation of dreams. His seminal work, `The Interpretation of Dreams` (1899), established dreams as `the royal road to the unconscious.`
Freud proposed that dreams represent wish fulfillment, where repressed desires and unconscious thoughts emerge in disguised forms. He distinguished between dreams' manifest content (what we remember) and latent content (hidden meanings). According to Freud, the mind employs `dream work` mechanisms such as condensation, displacement, and symbolization to transform forbidden wishes into less threatening imagery.
Throughout his career, Freud analyzed numerous dreams, including his own famous `Irma's injection` dream, to demonstrate how dreams reflect unconscious processes. His dream theory remained central to psychoanalytic practice, though many aspects have been challenged by later research.

scientists.name: Carl Jung
scientists.description: Swiss psychiatrist and psychoanalyst who founded analytical psychology.

scientists.name: Alfred Adler
scientists.description: Austrian medical doctor, psychotherapist, and founder of the school of individual psychology.

scientists.name: Calvin S. Hall
scientists.description: American psychologist known for his work on dream content analysis.

scientists.name: Ann Faraday
scientists.description: British psychologist and author known for popularizing dream interpretation techniques.

scientists.name: Patricia Garfield
scientists.description: American psychologist and author, pioneer in the study of lucid dreaming.

scientists.name: Jeremy Taylor
scientists.description: American author and dream worker known for projective dream work.

scientists.name: Ibn Sirin
scientists.description: Early Islamic scholar renowned for his work on dream interpretation.

scientists.name: Artemidorus
scientists.description: Ancient Greek professional diviner and dream interpreter.

scientists.name: Marie-Louise von Franz
scientists.description: Swiss Jungian psychologist and scholar, known for interpretations of fairy tales.

scientists.name: Pierre Janet
scientists.description: French psychologist, philosopher and psychotherapist in the field of dissociation and traumatic memory.

scientists.name: Erich Fromm
scientists.description: German social psychologist, psychoanalyst, sociologist, and humanistic philosopher.

scientists.name: William James
scientists.description: American philosopher, historian, and psychologist, and the first educator to offer a psychology course in the United States.

scientists.name: Milton H. Erickson
scientists.description: American psychiatrist and psychologist specializing in medical hypnosis and family therapy.

scientists.name: Karen Horney
scientists.description: German psychoanalyst who practiced in the United States during her later career.
